item.title: Razer CEO Explains Why Grok Powers Its New ‚ÄòWaifu‚Äô Hologram
item.content:encoded:
That‚Äôs a pretty interesting and loaded title. Recently, Razer unveiled Project AVA, an AI-powered desktop device that houses a holographic representation of what has been described as a ‚Äòwaifu‚Äô. The cylindrical device uses Grok AI and dynamic personality metrics to embody a 3D hologram with ‚Äòhuman-life vision‚Äô and ‚Äòfull contextual awareness‚Äô.

The conceptual device has been described as an ‚Äòenthusiastic gaming wingman,‚Äô and it sits on your desk, organizes your day, and keeps you company with a conversational model backed (at least initially) by Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok AI.

Recently, the firm‚Äôs CEO explained why they‚Äôre leading the way with Grok, given all the recent scandals.

Why is Project AVA Using Grok? Because It‚Äôs the Best

Project AVA was unveiled by Razer at CES, emerging as one of the most innovative (and perhaps invasive) inventions at the show. It‚Äôs a small, Razer Chroma-backed tubular device that has minimal inputs and maximum practicality, apparently. It has an HD camera, microphones, an LED system, and, most importantly, a 5.5-inch, 3D holographic avatar projection system.

Razer has unveiled a string of ‚Äòcompanions‚Äô that users can pick from to power their wingman device. It‚Äôs a relatively bizarre lineup, but it‚Äôs worth stressing right now that there‚Äôs no release date for the device. Razer has no idea when Project AVA will leave the conceptual stage.

First, there‚Äôs AVA, a throbbing circle of Razer-branded energy that doesn‚Äôt take a human form. There‚Äôs Kira, your traditional anime waifu model, dubbed the ‚Äòloveliest gaming partner‚Äô, and then there‚Äôs Zane, a muscular, traditionally handsome, and tattooed male model.

The roster continues with Lee ‚ÄúFaker‚Äù Sang-hyeok, one of the most recognizable esports pro players in the world and a certified GOAT of the League of Legends space. Finally, you‚Äôve got SAO, a corporate female character modelled on kawausosuki0513, a Japanese ‚Äòoffice lady‚Äô creator.

Right now, the biggest point of contention around Project AVA is the fact that Grok is the AI engine powering its development. In recent weeks, Grok has come under intense fire as the AI model has been stripping people naked on Twitter (now known as X) at the simplest request.

In a recent interview, Razer‚Äôs CEO, Min-Liang Tan, explained why the company had gone with Grok first:

Well, I think for Grok, you know‚Ä¶ We picked Grok also because it‚Äôs got the best conversational AI at this point, for us. At least from a conversation, personality side of things, and that‚Äôs one of the things that we looked at from a tech perspective. Now, ultimately, however, we do see Ava as an open platform, right?

If somebody wants to be able to use a different model, it‚Äôs one of the things that we‚Äôre taking into consideration. And we are multi-model, right? But I think from a perspective of an avatar, from a conversational AI for CES, we feel that Grok has a really great conversational AI model at this point. So that‚Äôs one of the reasons why we picked Grok.

When asked how Razer can ensure user safety, Tan said:

I think we‚Äôre still in the early days. Now, the question, I think, where it‚Äôs going to lead to is something that we need to discover, right? And, of course, we need to discover it in a responsible manner to figure out how we do that, and put the right guardrails in. What do we do in terms of AI, in terms of this? That‚Äôs something that we‚Äôre learning.

Now, maybe it‚Äôs even a hardware lock that we need to put in. We don‚Äôt know, right? Or it‚Äôs more software guardrails that we have to put into place at this point in time.

That‚Äôs one of the reasons why we decided to put it as a concept first out there, to get the feedback. And we‚Äôre not gonna be able to think of everything, but we would like to be able to get as much thought, concern, and care into the product before we actually launch it.

Do you think there‚Äôs anything super concerning about having a Grok-powered device with cameras and microphones on your desk? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming tech coverage, check out the news that the Google Pixel 10A could be released this March

item.title: Six Invitational 2026 Groups Unveiled by Ubisoft
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft has revealed the group draw for the Six Invitational 2026, setting the stage for one of the largest esports events in the entire business. What has been uncovered reflects a stunning selection that should make for some exciting match-ups straight out of the gate.

As usual, the tournament begins with four groups of five teams competing for spots in the playoffs. The two-bracket split will be populated by these teams, but not every organization in the group stage will advance to the final round. Four teams will be eliminated before they can make it anywhere close to the final stage.

Six Invitational 2026 Groups Confirmed

The group draw for the Six Invitational 2026 was completed recently by Ubisoft:

Group A:

  • Weibo Gaming
  • M80
  • FEARX
  • Ninjas in Pyjamas
  • Project Zero

Group B:

  • Team Falcons
  • FURIA
  • Elevate
  • Wildcard
  • Daystar

Group C:

  • FaZe Clan
  • G2 Esports
  • Shopify Rebellion
  • DPlus
  • Black Dragons

Group D:

  • Spacestation
  • Team Secret
  • Fluxo W7M
  • ENTERPRISE Esports
  • Oxygen Esports

It could be argued that Group C is the most energetic and unpredictable of the bunch. FaZe Clan, G2, and Shopify Rebellion are all the most legitimate contenders for the trophy, and we‚Äôre sure to see sparks fly in Paris before the playoffs even kick off.

Group D is also bursting with potential. Every team there has a credible playoff claim, with Team Secret especially coming in as the Esports World Cup 2025 champions.

As always, the Six Invitational will remain relatively hard to pin down. It has one of the largest single prizes in the esports space, so you‚Äôd best believe every team taking to the stage will fight tooth and nail to secure the biggest chunk of it.

Which team do you have taking the win in Paris next month? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the list of all the games at the Esports World Cup 2026

item.title: Every Esports World Cup 2026 Game‚ÄîAll Games Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
This year‚Äôs Esports World Cup promises to be the most monumental event in the industry‚Äôs history. There are more games, a bigger prize pool, and a wider array of competitors than ever before. The event is set to run in Riyadh from July 6 to August 23, and twenty-four games will share the grandest stages in the business.

Below, we‚Äôve outlined every Esports World Cup game being hosted at the showcase in 2026.

All EWC 2026 Games

From first-person shooters to racing games, and from battle royale titles to MOBAs, there truly is something for everyone at the Esports World Cup 2026.

Here‚Äôs the full list of games with a place at EWC 2026:

  • Apex Legends
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
  • Call of Duty: Warzone
  • Chess
  • Counter-Strike 2
  • Crossfire
  • Dota 2
  • EA Sports FC 26
  • FATAL FURY: City of the Wolves
  • Fortnite
  • Free Fire
  • Honor of Kings
  • League of Legends
  • Mobile Legends: Bang Bang
  • Overwatch 2
  • PUBG: Battlegrounds
  • PUBG Mobile
  • Rocket League
  • Street Fighter 6
  • TEKKEN 8
  • Tom Clancy‚Äôs Rainbow Six Siege X
  • Teamfight Tactics
  • Trackmania
  • VALORANT

The newest additions to the lineup this year are Fortnite and Trackmania, both of which are highly anticipated titles with sizeable prize pools. That being said, the entire event boasts a staggering pool, the largest pool in esports history.

While the Esports World Cup Foundation is yet to confirm the full EWC 2026 schedule, just knowing what‚Äôs on the horizon is enough for fans of the event to start getting excited. This is easily the grandest event in the entire esports space.

Will you be watching the Esports World Cup 2026? Let us know what game you‚Äôre most excited to see on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the new roadmap for Year 6 of the Apex Legends Global Series

item.title: Tarkov Dev‚Äôs New Game Could Be Revealed on February 1st
item.content:encoded:
Over the last couple of weeks, the head of the studio at Battlestate Games, Nikita Buyanov, busied himself posting cryptic images and brain teasers on social media. Eventually, an entirely new website surfaced, seemingly hosting some minigame teasing a new project called COR3.

Now, another website has surfaced, this one hosting nothing more than a countdown and a blurry video that, when examined, represents a first-person shooter that scales back to show an entire planet. That countdown expires on February 1st, which is when everyone believes we‚Äôll get something tangible about this game.

What is COR3, and Why is it Exciting?

Nikita Buyanov is one of the creative minds who has directed the growth of Escape from Tarkov over the last decade. He has dedicated his life to the extraction shooter, a fact that he pointed out when we interviewed him as part of a recent episode of Access Granted.

He recently took a cryptic turn on social media, posting stacks of enigmatic images and puzzles, which his followers set to decoding.

Before long, a website had been found, an interactive thing that placed users in some kind of post-apocalyptic bunker with a retro-futuristic computer system bursting with lore, teasers, and world-building elements. As it stands, we have little idea what COR3 is, but the best guess is that it‚Äôs Buyanov‚Äôs new project.

We say ‚ÄòBuyanov‚Äô and not Battlestate Games, as right now, there‚Äôs no indication that Battlestate is linked to COR3. The COR3 trademark, dug up by eagle-eyed netizens, is in Nikita‚Äôs name, and nobody but the man himself has been sharing content related to COR3 online.

On the countdown website, a clock is running out, and it‚Äôs set to expire on February 1st at 3 PM GMT / 10 AM EST. Nobody knows what will happen when that countdown hits zero, but it‚Äôs a safe bet that something more tangible will be revealed by Buyanov, and whoever else he‚Äôs working with (if anyone).

COR3 appears to represent some kind of alternate reality title set in a universe where Earth suffered from a catastrophic event. There‚Äôs talk of interplanetary travel, space pirates, and ships adrift in the great beyond, all of which couldn‚Äôt be further from Escape from Tarkov, the leading extraction shooter.

It‚Äôs set hundreds of years in the future, but the COR3 website that users could interact with boasted grounded elements like modern-day armor items and traditional computers.

What do you think Nikita‚Äôs new game is? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the tease for Stellar Blade 2‚Äôs location

item.title: Destiny 2 Shadow and Order Has Reportedly Been Delayed
item.content:encoded:
Destiny 2‚Äôs next major update has reportedly been delayed due to the forthcoming release of Marathon, Bungie‚Äôs new extraction shooter, in early March.

Destiny 2: Shadow & Order was originally slated for a March 3 release. However, after Bungie officially announced Marathon‚Äôs release date on Monday, Forbes‚Äô Paul Tussi reported that the next free Destiny update has been postponed. There‚Äôs no tentative release window for the content at the moment.

Shadow & Order is slated to be the final major update of the Year of Prophecy season of the game, which started back with the Rite of the Nine in-game event that occurred in May 2025.

While it‚Äôs full steam ahead on the marketing push for Marathon, pre-ordering Bungie‚Äôs new game scores Destiny players new cosmetics, Sparrows, and Ships. There are also new shaders, emotes, and more in celebration of the upcoming release.

In addition, the marathon marketing push includes a new limited edition PlayStation DualSense and Pulse Elite wireless headset. Learn more about the latest items here.

Are you eager for the next chapter of Destiny 2 to unfold? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SCOOP: The Island Returns In WWE 2K26 With A New Story

Insider Gaming has learned first details surrounding The Island in WWE 2K26 as the mode returns for a second year.

Limited Edition Marathon DualSense Controller and Headset Coming

Bungie and PlayStation have unveiled a limited edition Marathon-themed DualSense controller and Pulse Elite headset.

Stellar Blade 2 Location Tease Points To Post-Apocalyptic China

In a post on social media, the team at Shift Up have suggested that Stellar Blade 2 will be inspired by post-apocalyptic China.
